I do like this product, but with some caveats. If you can get an annual subscription for $20 (or less), Tripp is worth it. There is currently not enough content or quality to warrant a higher price.

The core of the program are 2.5 meditation options. 1 for Focus and 1.5 for Calm. Both last ~8 minutes and consist of 3 scenes, 2 of which have breathing exercises and an outro which is just a visual. Narration can be switched off. The main difference between Focus and Calm is the inclusion of a mini-game (which NEVER changes) where you guide an avatar with your gaze to collect coins. Only Focus has this "game;" Calm scenarios omit it.

Calm is split into 2 options--one for Relaxation and one for Sleep Preparation. They are always the exact same experience, with Sleep Preparation only differentiated by (supposed) binaural audio to promote sleep.

I use the program nightly and find it beneficial. Because the scenarios are fairly short, I normally begin by doing Focus and then Calm (Sleep Preparation). I wish there were options for longer meditation randomized visuals. I often just switch to the free Cosmic Flow app (via SideQuest) which provides an outstanding alternative.
